titles.title: To amend title 18, United States Code, with respect to certain crimes relating to Congressional medals of honor.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 103-786.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 432.

action.text: Mr. Brooks moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote. (consideration: CR 10/7/1994 S14801-14802)

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 9/26/1994--Introduced. Amends the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994 to revise the definition of "Congressional Medal of Honor" to include such medals awarded to members of the Air Force, Navy, and Marines (currently, limited to Army).
